TopicTitle: What will YOU do with the science bay?

Articles.Content:
This part opens up opportunities to make things that seem pointless, slightly less pointless. Perceptually anyway.

I'd try to manuver the thing down the Mohole, or send one into the depths of Jool's glitchy 'surface'
I have no idea. What exactly is practical about the science package again?

It's a career mode item. when activated you will get research points for letting it perform experiments in an area, These points will unlock new parts and such. Paired with antennae, You can send the data back without having to return the bay back to Kerbin. This makes moronic, silly and sacrificial endeavures productive!

In the name of science of course.

What will I do with it?

SCIENCE!!!
Crash it into everything.
science tests with a mass driver
I suspect that science will be done and I'll make a neat gun for the Kerbals who are still alive.

I should have expected this...Good show, that. xD
It will send back data using antennae? So... are we talking speed of light or instantaneous transmission?

Do science of course.

I am thinking missions to different places and see what kind of results you can get.
I want a science module that can be smashed into a planet and send back some sciences.

I'll do what Danny would do

INTO KERBOL!!!!!

I suspect that science will be done and I'll make a neat gun for the Kerbals who are still alive.

I'm not even angry. I'm being so sincere, right now.

Fling them everywhere. Absolutely everywhere. If I get research points for returning data, then I'll LEAVE THEM THERE AS WELL.

Anything worth doing is worth overdoing. I will be swimming in research points. I will attach them to even my munar resupply vessels to squeeze some data out of it.

I'm not even angry. I'm being so sincere, right now.

For the good of all of them, except the ones who are dead?

(we'd better stop this now...)
It would be cool if the module had a camera on it, so you don't have to bother with the screenshots. It could just take photos, automatically, or manually.

It would be cool if the module had a camera on it, so you don't have to bother with the screenshots. It could just take photos, automatically, or manually.

What if you don't want your screenshots folder constantly being added to mysteriously? And manually is basically exactly the same as it is with some camera positioning.

Whatever you all think you're going to do with or to the science module, I think we can all agree to put our differences behind us. For science.

You monsters.

I suspect that science will be done and I'll make a neat gun for the Kerbals who are still alive.

I'm surprised it took till the 7th post for a portal reference to sneak in, what with the title begging for it so hard.

As far as the OP, I'm of course going to science at things. All over the place. It'll make a huge mess and I'll be ashamed.

Hm...truth be told i don't think I really care for career mode all that much. It's cool and all, but what's the wonderment in unlocking parts you've been using for years? Sry to poop on the party lol. Id just rather see other features being worked on instead. Ah well its early yet. I'm sure .22 will have much more in store for us other then the science/R&D package ( I hope ).

Thing is.. i saw in the preview that there's A LOT of research nodes. What will all these nodes do besides unlocking parts?
